titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to expand the exclusion for qualified small business stock, to increase the annual limit with respect to incentive stock options, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 10/2/1998--Introduced. Amends Internal Revenue Code provisions concerning the exclusion of gain from certain small business stock to, among other things: (1) increase from 50 to 75 percent the amount of gain excluded from the sale certain small business stock; (2) reduce from five to three years the holding period applicable to such a sale; (3) make such exclusion available to corporations; and (4) make the stock of larger businesses eligible. Doubles the annual limitation on incentive stock options.
